messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Re: New England Live & Learn Conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/3/03 8:45:42 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Kathryn, Let us all know when you have a web site or something.  We are planning to be there.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/3/03 8:45:42 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
glad2bmadly@... writes:

> I think you'll have a good time. Peabody is very near Boston, Salem, etc.
> Without too much drama, you can get public transportation into Boston so you
>
> don't have drive there, and it's a lot less expensive than staying in the
> city.
> And if you want, you can get into Southern Maine in less than two hours

Kathryn,
Let us all know when you have a web site or something. We are planning to be
there. I grew up in Maine and so want to show the boys the Boston area and
make a trip home before or after the conference.
Can't wait.
Pam G.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: New England Live & Learn Conference
messages.msgSnippet: Janis, I m sure that would be lots of fun. We ll have to check it out. Thanks! ... Kathryn, Sounds great! I m glad to hear I ll be able to get to Boston
messages.messageBody:
Janis,
I'm sure that would be lots of fun. We'll have to check it out. Thanks!

> From: "coyote's corner" <jana@...>
> We can plan on a powwow!! There's a great powwow around that time at Colt
> State Park - a beautiful park, a great powwow in beautiful Bristol.
>
> Brianna & I traipse all over - we can help put a list together.....
> Janis

Kathryn,
Sounds great! I'm glad to hear I'll be able to get to Boston easily.
We'll probably have to take 2 weeks. LOL! We'll see how the $$ pans out. So
much to do and see. Thanks again. :-)

> I think you'll have a good time. Peabody is very near Boston, Salem, etc.
> Without too much drama, you can get public transportation into Boston so you
> don't have drive there, and it's a lot less expensive than staying in the
> city.
> And if you want, you can get into Southern Maine in less than two hours.
>
> Kathryn


Barb E
"Just as our eyes need light in order to see, our minds
need ideas in order to conceive. "

- Napoleon Hill, Author

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] New England Live & Learn Conference
messages.msgSnippet: We can plan on a powwow!! There s a great powwow around that time at Colt State Park - a beautiful park, a great powwow in beautiful Bristol. Brianna & I
messages.messageBody:
We can plan on a powwow!! There's a great powwow around that time at Colt State Park - a beautiful park, a great powwow in beautiful Bristol.

Brianna & I traipse all over - we can help put a list together.....
Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: Barb Eaton
To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, July 02, 2003 8:01 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-Discussion] New England Live & Learn Conference


WOOHOO! I am trying to plan to stay longer or come in early. Now it's a
clencher with it being right around my birthday. <sg> I've wanted to take
the boys to see some of the sights in that area for the longest time. I've
never been so it will be a treat for us all. Thanks Kathryn for all you're
doing to get this going. Kelly's done a wonderful job in SC and I know
you'll get it together and it will be great too. :-)


Barb E

"If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not
a tree. You have the ability to totally transform every
area in your life - and it all begins with your very own
power of choice."

- Jim Rohn, Author and speaker




> Date: Tue, 1 Jul 2003 15:09:01 EDT
> From: KathrynJB@...
>
> Why, yes, in fact, I >DO< have dates! It is ending up in August because all
> the other times would have doubled the cost of the conference.
>
> So...Keep the following dates clear:
> Live & Learn New England Conference
> August 27-29 in Peabody, Massachusetts
>
> There will be cool extras, like a Whale Watch, etc.
>
> Kathryn

Ahhhh, that is too cool! How much closer could it get to September! Wahoo!

Thanks Kathryn, I'm going to start selling that one now. I love the New England area!


Kelli~

messages.subject: New England Live & Learn Conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/1/2003 2:59:19 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Why, yes, in fact, I DO
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/1/2003 2:59:19 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com writes:

> You don't have any dates yet for that do you? I was wondering what part
> of August you're looking at. I think we might plan a little trip up to
> Canada(PEI) after. I'm already trying to pull a new homeschooler with me to MA,
> she's teterring toward unschooling! <g> This week she mentioned that she
> wanted to go to Prince Edward Island the beginning of September and I said,
> "well, you should come to the next unschooling conference! And we can go up
> after that!". My conniving little mind.
>
> Kelli~who is still counting down the days 'til this year's one. 45 days
> until we leave!
>
>

Why, yes, in fact, I >DO< have dates! It is ending up in August because all
the other times would have doubled the cost of the conference.

So...Keep the following dates clear:
Live & Learn New England Conference
August 27-29 in Peabody, Massachusetts

There will be cool extras, like a Whale Watch, etc.

Kathryn
